definition: Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
Itsukujima shrine in Hiroshima prefecture, Japan

sentences.english: If it is referring to the Shinto shrine, then known as the Torii gate.
sentences.chinese: 如果是指神道教的神社的話，那個門叫做鳥居。

sentences.english: Tracy: Oh, I've heard of it.
And I would like to visit the Itsukushima Shinto Shrine there.
sentences.chinese: 我還想去看看那兒的嚴島神社。

sentences.english: Toil and sweat done, an apprentice meditates before a Shinto shrine.
sentences.chinese: 一個新手在付出辛勞和汗水後蹲坐在神社前。

sentences.english: Will Premier Wen press Abe to make commitment of not visiting the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶總理是否會讓安倍作出不參拜靖國神社的承諾？

sentences.english: The key point of the worship is negating history and justifying Japan's military aggression.
sentences.chinese: 而參拜靖國神社就是爲了把軍國主義侵略史正當化。

sentences.english: The Anima Shrine, but legends say that it was built in order to.
sentences.chinese: 該動物靖國神社，但傳說中指出，這是建立在以。

sentences.english: How many post-war Japanese prime ministers have visited the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 戰後日本有多少首相曾去靖國神社參拜？

sentences.english: Yasukuni Shrine is the spiritual pillar of Japanese militarist aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社是日本軍國主義對外侵略擴張的精神支柱。

sentences.english: The Japanese leaders insisted on visiting the Yasukuni Shrine that worships Class-A war criminals during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 日本領導人堅持參拜供奉甲級戰犯的靖國神社。

sentences.english: The shrine becomes ransacked by one of the evil princes, Atmos.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社成爲洗劫一個邪惡王子，大氣。

sentences.english: Yasuguni Shrine has become a spiritual pillar of Japanese militarists' policy of aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖國神社是日本軍國主義對外侵略擴張的精神支柱。

sentences.english: It seem that each time a Japanese backbencher MP visits a shrine, relations goes sour. Stupid.
sentences.chinese: 每次日本議員參拜神社，兩國關係就會變冷。

sentences.english: WOMAN:And Kotori-chan always brings me flowers from the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 小鳥總是帶神社的花給我呢。

definition: Heian Jingū or Heian Shrine, in Kyōto, Japan
Itsukujima shrine in Hiroshima prefecture, Japan
Himeji-jō, castle complex in Himeji, Hyōgo prefecture 兵庫縣|兵库县, Japan
Kiyomizu temple in east Kyōto 京都, Japan
Kamakura city in Kanagawa prefecture 神奈川縣|神奈川县[Shen2 nai4 chuan1 xian4], Japan
Nara, an old capital of Japan
Ginkakuji or Silver pavilion in northeast Kyōto 京都, Japan/officially called Jishōji 慈照寺[Ci2 zhao4 si4]
Hōryūji, complex of Buddhist temples near Nara 奈良, Japan, dating back to the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代 (c. 600)
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
